result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
+ 400.00 signature bond.
No contact with Shayliyah Tourtillott, No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

+ 400.00 signature bond.
No contact with Shayliyah Tourtillott, No entry into any Class B licensed establishments. Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription. No travel outside the state without prior court approval.

1:09 PM Defendant ANTHONY L. PEREZ in court, in custody.  Attorney Gregory A. Parker in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for public defender services, but counsel has not been appointed yet. Defendant chooses to proceed with the preliminary hearing.  Court reviews the charges with the defendant and advises party of his right to counsel.  Defendant changes his mind and waives the time limits for preliminary hearing waiting for counsel.  Defendant makes a motion for bond modification.  Suggests modification of bond to $300.00 cash plus $400.00 for signature.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
